info.author: Stevemats
info.description:
==============
                                    @@@ Polls @@@
                                    ==============

Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each
question, visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers to
vote on.

Detailed documentation is in the "docs" directory.

Quick start

-----------

1. Add "polls" to your INSTALLED_APPS setting like this::

  INSTALLED_APPS = [
      ...
      'polls',

  ]

2. Include the polls URLconf in your project's urls.py like this::

     path('polls/', include('polls.urls')),

   remember to put the comma(,) at the end

3. Run `python manage.py migrate` to create the polls models.

4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/
   to create a poll (you'll need the Admin app enabled).

5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to participate in the poll.
info.name: django-bay-polls
info.summary: Django app to be used in conducting Web-based polls.
info.html_description:
==============
@@@ Polls @@@
==============

Polls is a simple Django app to conduct Web-based polls. For each
question, visitors can choose between a fixed number of answers to
vote on.

Detailed documentation is in the "docs" directory.

Quick start

-----------

1. Add "polls" to your INSTALLED_APPS setting like this::

INSTALLED_APPS = [
...
'polls',

]

2. Include the polls URLconf in your project's urls.py like this::

path('polls/', include('polls.urls')),

remember to put the comma(,) at the end

3. Run `python manage.py migrate` to create the polls models.

4. Start the development server and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin/
to create a poll (you'll need the Admin app enabled).

5. Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/polls/ to participate in the poll.
